title: How to Make Santa Cookies

steps.headline: Melt the white chocolate in a substantial saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally to keep them from burning.
Plunge one end of each cookie into the melted chocolate.
Put them on a wire rack to begin setting.
Drizzle red sugar on top part of chocolate for Santa's hat.
Put one vanilla chip off-center on the hat to make a pom-pom and let it until set.
Melt the semisweet chocolate chips over low heat until they melt in another saucepan.
Let the chocolate cool for 10 minutes and then dip the other end of each cookie into the molten chocolate to make the beard.
steps.description: Leave the center of the cookie completely uncovered and then place each one back on the wire racks.

steps.headline: Add on the semisweet chips for the eyes and a red-hot with a bit of meted chocolate, or red mini M&M's, for the nose.
Place the cookies on the waxed paper until the chocolate sets.
steps.description: If you're in a hurry, you can put them in the fridge to cool faster.

text: Melt the white chocolate in a substantial saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally to keep them from burning.  Plunge one end of each cookie into the melted chocolate.  Put them on a wire rack to begin setting.  Drizzle red sugar on top part of chocolate for Santa's hat.  Put one vanilla chip off-center on the hat to make a pom-pom and let it until set.  Melt the semisweet chocolate chips over low heat until they melt in another saucepan.  Let the chocolate cool for 10 minutes and then dip the other end of each cookie into the molten chocolate to make the beard. Leave the center of the cookie completely uncovered and then place each one back on the wire racks. Add on the semisweet chips for the eyes and a red-hot with a bit of meted chocolate, or red mini M&M's, for the nose.  Place the cookies on the waxed paper until the chocolate sets. If you're in a hurry, you can put them in the fridge to cool faster. Done!
